Name: Statuette of Osiris
Description: Osiris is represented standing on a rectangular base with a representation of a Solar boat on its front surface. His body is enveloped in a tightly fitting mummy gown leaving exposed only his hands holding a crook and a flail; he wears an atef-crown with ram's horns, and a pleated artificial beard. A relief representation of winged Isis is placed on the back of the statuette. She wears a long dress, a wig, a vulture headdress and a diadem with cow's horns, sun disk and ostrich feathers; in her either hand she holds an ostrich feather; she stands on the hieroglyph for gold.
